creator: papi@webartwiz.com
text:
HI there,

I installed apache 2.0.52 on a new server, I setted implicit flush on, output 
buffer 4096 or off as the issue still remains. 
then, I use a script, I submit a form and on the new script I send 
document.open(), document write('bla bla'); document close e.g. (using correct 
javascript) then under php I use flush();
off course, it should send to the client what it have until now, but, I still 
see the content of the previous script. Even if I put comments just to have 
more text and to force the flush it still does not work. 
Also, on apache 2.0.46 it is working fine and also on httpd-2.0.54

so, do you have any idea?

Sorry, but your error description is very confusing as you do not describe
exactly what you have configured in httpd, what kind of 3rd party modules you
use (I guess php) and what you are doing exactly. Anyway as you state that
everything works fine with httpd 2.0.54, there is no need for any action. So
just use it and everything is fine.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
papi@webartwiz.com
text:
this issue has been solved by changing default_mimetype to "" from text/html

also, it is working without change this on other systems. I was not able to 
find why until now, but, this can be solved by others by changing that 
variable in php.ini file
